reviews.review_msg: Easy class, just quite repetitive from what I'd learnt in high school so I did not apply myself. Her lectures were all recorded and watch on your own time, readings, quizzes and discussion posts. Marking is extremely reasonable. Quizzes are simple, but on a time crunch, 20 questions in 20 mins (only hard part about this course lol).

A great class and very straight forward. There are readings and a quiz every week, and a group discussion happens every 2 weeks, there is also a final essay. Very easy to pass, and TAs are good markers, and provide good feedback.

Lessons include a lot of readings that are very, very long and you will be tested on them along with lecture material. Additionally, the test questions are extremely specific so it is hard to know what to study. Discussion post grading is unclear and complicated and the overall course design is messy. Do not take this course if you can help it!!!
Do not take a course with this prof. Overcomplicates things as simple as a discussion post and grades horribly with no feedback. Quizzes are incredibly specific.

Joyce seems passionate about the topic which is great. BUT the readings are long and bland, the quizzes are way too specific and difficult, lectures provide terrible explanations, the course format is disorganized, and the way everything is presented seems like it is trying to make us fail. DO NOT take this course.

Took INDG 286; most confusing course and prof. Quizzes were 40% of the final and were so specific on the readings. All the lectures were the same. Very unclear what she expected from us. She randomly gave everyone that came to the last class an extra mark. Didn't gain anything from that course

I have to agree with the reviews here. This entire course needs redesigning. The quizzes have too many questions and not enough time to finish. A lot of reading material and quizzed on minor details. Writing submissions received little to no feedback. told to follow a rubric, but not clear on why low grade is given.

The quizzes were horribly designed and almost made it impossible for you to do well. The lectures were dry and I found them to be quite useless. I would have loved to learn about Indigenous cultures but they did it in the worst way possible. 100% recommend to TAKE IT ONLINE; it wasn't great but I would have never survived it in-person.

INDG studies should be a component of all UG degrees and I've completed a few with different instructors, unfortunately this is not a prof I will recommend. I think you will get a better learning experience with a different instructor and hopefully see your quiz results and get fair marking with feedback. Disappointingly, you won't find that here.

Terrible course design, outdated, not tech savvy. Lectures are poorly recorded & old, tell you to focus on content that does not show up on quizzes. How do you learn when you submit papers & assignments but don't find out right & wrong answers on quizzes or get feedback on assignments/term paper? She's either too busy or doesn't care.
I went from A+ to a C because of the quizzes. Horrible course design.
I just did the last quiz. It wasn't even related to any of the readings or lectures.

I failed all my quizzes and my group mates never responded to me. I got 3/10 every week but nobody cared about me. I am so sad. This class makes me cry every day. MATH 157 was a better course. Uncle Imin Chen for the win. Don't take it with her. Take INDG 101 with Imin.

I appreciate her insights and everything but the way she designed the course is a pain for many students. There's a lot of readings (60+ pgs), all of which can be asked on the quiz. However, the quiz is supposed to be 'closed book' which makes it nearly impossible to do well on. There's so many questions on the quiz and little time to complete it.

Literally, Joyce is the worst and laziest prof of my university career, it's not even close! Most of my classmates from this course had terrible experiences too. Final paper was marked unfairly and her feedback was extremely rude and passive-aggressive. I closely followed instructions until Joyce told me that I did a terrible job. Horrendous prof.

Her recorded lectures are old and she just reads the slides. She does not explain anything, just says "you know" and moves on. There is a lot of reading, which is very dry and hard to understand. She didn't grade too hard; just follow her guidelines of capitalizing and pluralizing.

The class sacrifices your learning to push a political agenda. Kicya makes it very clear that only her viewpoint will be tolerated, and is not respecting of anything else. Seems as though she doesn't actually read the discussion posts she's grading and just picks grades at random. 
Don't take the class if you actually want to learn anything.

Honestly the worst class I took at SFU. Grading was unclear and feedback was minimal and unhelpful. Assignments were not clear and she did not offer useful help. I was excited to learn more about Indigenous Peoples but this course taught me nothing.

Insane amount for work. Quizzes can sometimes cover  60+ pages of reading, 4 powerpoint and 4+ videos,  20 minutes long. Quizzes are from memory. She is very forceful in demanding students see her perspective as the only perspective. Everyone receives the same grade in group projects so you will be docked marks for mistakes other people make.

Do not take a class with Kicya7. She is incredibly unfair with grading and course structure. We are forced to attend lectures and take notes on things that aren't examined on. And then there are super long readings with tiny text that we are expected to memorize and be quizzed on. And her grading criteria is ruthless af, and she is so brainwashed.

I think INDG101 is a class that has potential, but Kicya7 absolutely screws it up. It's important, as "Canadians" to understand more about Indigenous peoples in BC. But Kicya7 makes the whole class incredibly boring and painful. I am also struggling with the fact that Kicya7 is an anti-Vaxxer. Tough to come to terms with this fact.

I think most professors realize that political bias needs to be kept out of lectures, but this professor definitely thinks the opposite of that. The anti-vax stuff and her rhetoric around covid and government distrust is appalling. And her marking scheme is nonsensical, minus 10 marks for spelling is ridiculous.

the amount of reading that Kicya7 gives is super unreasonable. 30 pages of reading usually! released on Tuesday and you have to read them before friday! and in lectures, nothing is covered except arguments and you are left to figure things out on your own. this course has some worthwhile content but Kicya7's delivery of the course is horrendous.

It's an interesting class that explores many different topics that are important to today's society. The quizzes are worded very strangely and you will lose a lot of marks from them. The feedback throughout the final paper was horrible and it felt like my challenges were being ignored. The grading criteria was vague and unclear.

Joyce is disorganized and inconsistent. Uninspiring and will unfairly penalize you if you write a paper that she deems as not good. I have taken many INDG courses with many different profs, and they are all great except for Joyce. Her feedback to my paper was borderline insulting and rude. I was shocked that a prof would act like this! Never again.
Material is very worthwhile especially in todays society, however the structure of the class isn't very good at all. Take with a different prof.

Despite Indg being a great class for us as mostly settlers to learn about Indigenous peoples. Her class is very boring. The quiz structure is horrendous, the group assignments are a joke especially when they are 30% of your grade. Lastly the term paper is very specific for only 20%. Take the class, just with a different prof.

I think INDG101 is a class that everyone should take. It's important, as "Canadians" to understand the knowledge and ongoing struggles of Indigenous peoples in BC. However, I am very pro-vaccine (I believe strongly in science), and I am struggling with the fact that Kicya7 is an anti-Vaxxer. Tough to come to terms with this fact.

Kicya7 is an amazing teacher and scholar! I am so thankful for the perspectives she provided in INDG 101. She always encouraged discussion, question and team building in lecture and group projects. The assignments are graded fairly, and with an aim to decolonize the language we use. I learned and grew so much in this course.

Kicya7 was a great professor and the content of this course is amazing. However, this course is not an easy A, as there are weekly assignments or quizzes and readings were quite long. Also, marking was not always 100% clear. If you put in the work you should get a good grade!

Joyce was very disorganized and made the semester very difficult for students, even under tremendous circumstances. Students were not allowed to "perpetuate colonial practices or perspectives", and if we do, then they are heavily penalized! Many students in the class (friends) strongly recommend NOT taking this course with Joyce.

Kicya7 was a VERY good prof, and I would take her class again in a heartbeat. Made online learning feel not so distant as most of my other classes are pre-recorded, and hers were live! she's very caring and teaches her lessons well! Definitely take her class if you have the opportunity!
Honestly just a really great person. She really cares about the material she teaches about, and it comes across very passionate and authentic. Course content fairly easy as well. Highly recommend.

Maddie is a super sweet and understanding prof. If you love class discussion and working with others, this class is great because we often discussed our readings in small groups and shared. The topic is also extremely important. We need to know Canada's brutal history.

Professor Dielissen is a real gem. One of the best profs I've had at SFU, she's approachable and willing to help in any way you need. Dielissen made the course content interesting and the assignment criteria/grading is clear. All I can say is she's an amazing prof and I will be taking more courses with her before graduating! :)

The 2 midterms and 1 essay was worth majority of the grade. The grading was extremely unclear because my classmates and I followed all the directions and instructions but ended up with a grade that didn't match our work. When I asked for clarifying questions on improving I only got vague answers that were already written in the feedback.

This class was terrible - be warned that the quizzes are worth A LOT. Each quiz is 10%*5=50% of ur grade. And they are VERY hard. Do urself a favor and prep like crazy with ur friends beforehand. Otherwise discussions and assignments are super easy. If your smart about the quizzes and do well, easy A+. Genuinely no idea why the quizzes r like this.

great prof! she handled the topics well and made sure we really understood them. super caring and knowledgeable. had 2 tests that were really easy if you studied (all material from the class with no surprises). attendance is mandatory as there are discussions worth participation points. as an Indigenous student myself I really enjoyed the class!
Great class, everything we learned was on the tests, so no surprises. Excellent slide decks, and I actually learned. Would recommend

I had my first Indigenous Studies class with Dr. Shield. She's such a sweetheart and demonstrated her knowledge in the topics well. I was really interested in the course. We had to be tested by two quizzes, where are like exams. Review the slides enough to know what you write. Participation is group work and easy to earn.

meh being my first indg course. attendance is mandatory if you miss class you only got slides to read cuz lecs aren't recorded. didn't really like the class bc everything was in-person even the "quizzes" prof also didn't do much to prepare us aside from telling us to look over slides+emailed us guest speaker slides after the quiz so thats nice lol

This is my first Indigenous studies course, and I love learning from Dr. Shield. She's such a sweetheart and full of positive energy. If you have a chance, please take the class with her. The topics are so interesting too. The two quizzes were easy if you studied enough. Participation is through weekly questions with your groups!

Dr. Shield is an amazing professor who is very passionate about what she teaches. She presented the material each week in a very digestible and meaningful way, making the course super engaging and interesting despite it being fully asynchronous. She is a very knowledgable and kind person, I'd highly recommend taking an INDG course with her!

Alix was an amazing prof this summer. Took Indg101 as an intersession class and she tried to make lectures feel less intense as they had so much info packed into them. super interesting class and she does a great job respectfully teaching us about Indigenous culture and history.
To add on with the previous rating , she mark assignments very slow and till now I still NEVER GET TO KNOW MY MID TERM GRADES!!!!!!!!!!!

This course is very easy but she NEVER answers to my emails!!!! I once sent her an email regarding the grades of final paper, she didnt answer to my gmail , few days later she released the final grade ;-; BRUH

Didnt study a thing for her class coz all exams were online and i just got A+ in all exams thru chatgpt. Her grading is okay ish but gives u chances to improve ur grade. Lectures can be pretty boring but its very easy to score A in this class if ur smart with technology. Overall she is nice
From Kwantlen-- She never answers emails, never posts lectures, and assigns 3 10-20 pages of reading. I'm sure she's a lovely lady, but I found this course to be unfulfilling.

does not reply to emails AT ALL, forgets to add questions to quizzes, does not mark on time, assigns several lengthy readings instead of recording lectures, does not clarify anything-- we've had to resort to talking to the dean about her. probably the most absent teacher i've ever had in the last three years.
She is a really good teacher!

I took synchronous class so there was attendance. Treena was very understanding and flexible (just talk to her). The material was fine (basically Indigenous history). The workload was not too bad (like one short essay per week). I was off the track for a while but she helped me a lot so I got A-.
